page_analysis.text_content:
Porches
&
entry
features

Facades with defined
entryways make a
streetscape pleasant
and friendly as long as
they are not out of scale
or proportion.

The gross floor area
regulations encourage
appropriately sized
porches and entryways.

Code sections
18.04.030(a)(65)
18.04.030(a)(113.1)
18.04.030(143.5)
18.12.040(b)Table 3

6

Porch types

For purposes of assessing gross floor area, porches, entryways, and balconies fall into one of these categories:

1. Non-roofed porches, entryways, balconies etc.
   • Non-roofed features generally do not count

2. Roofed porches on the 1st floor (Fig 4 A & D on p. 7, Fig 5 on p. 8)
   • Openess of the sides determines whether or not these count
     regardless of the height.
   • If they do count, they count only once.

3. Roofed entry features on the 1st floor
   that are less than 12' high (from grade) (Fig 4 B on p. 7)
   • These count once regardless of the design including openess.

4. Roofed entry features on the 1st floor that are more than 12'
   high from grade–“vaulted entry feature” (Fig 4 C & D on p. 7,
   Fig 6, 7, & 8 on pp. 11-13)
   • These count twice regardless of the design including openess.

5. Recessed porches on the 1st floor (Fig 9 on p. 14)
   • Height, depth, & openess determine whether or not these count.
   • If they count and are less than 17' high, they count only once.
   • If they count and are more than 17' high, they count twice.

6. Roofed balconies/outdoor areas on upper floors (Fig 10 on p. 15)
   • These count once regardless of the design including openess

Difference
between a porch
& an entry
feature:

A feature is considered
to be a porch rather than
an entry feature if it can
clearly accomodate more
activities than entering and
leaving the house.

The following pages address the details of assessing these features with regard to gross floor area.

visual_elements.description: A dark grey vertical sidebar on the left third of the page. It contains the main page title 'Porches & entry features', introductory text, a 'Code sections' list, and the page number '6'. The text is white.
A dark grey rectangular box on the right side of the page. It contains the heading 'Difference between a porch & an entry feature:' and a paragraph of explanatory text. The text is white.
visual_elements.location: Right side of the page, middle

visual_elements.description: Highlighted keywords within the main text. Words like 'porches', 'entryways, balconies etc.', 'entry features', and 'balconies/outdoor areas' are highlighted with a dark grey background and white text for emphasis.
visual_elements.location: Within the numbered list in the main content area

The page has a three-column layout: a left sidebar, a central main content area, and a right-side informational box.
The term 'openess' is used multiple times, which may be a misspelling of 'openness'.
